skill.name: test-driven-development
skill.description: Use when implementing any feature or bugfix, before writing implementation code
skill.summary: Use when implementing any feature or bugfix, before writing implementation code
skill.author: Cycleaddict

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing TDD best practices and guidelines. The static scanner flagged pattern matches in test code examples that are benign educational content. All 85 detected findings are false positives: mock patterns were misidentified as cryptographic algorithms, markdown code fences were misidentified as shell execution, and documentation references were misidentified as reconnaissance. No executable code, network calls, or file system access exists in this skill.

content.value_statement: Writing tests after code leads to bugs and poor design. This skill enforces strict TDD discipline with red-green-refactor cycles for bulletproof code.
actual_capabilities: Prevents testing anti-patterns and mock abuse
Provides verification checklists for TDD compliance
Teaches minimal implementation and refactoring principles
limitations: Requires discipline to delete code written without tests
Not suitable for throwaway prototypes without permission
Demands commitment to watching tests fail before implementing

use_cases.title: Implement new features
use_cases.description: Use TDD to write bulletproof code that works correctly from the start, with tests that prove functionality.

use_cases.title: Fix bugs without regressions
use_cases.description: Write failing tests that reproduce bugs, then implement minimal fixes while preventing new issues.

use_cases.title: Ensure code quality
use_cases.description: Verify that all code follows TDD principles with proper test coverage and minimal implementations.

prompt_templates.title: Start TDD for feature
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to implement user authentication. Help me write the first failing test for login functionality using TDD principles.

prompt_templates.title: Write failing test
prompt_templates.prompt: Empty emails are being accepted. Guide me through writing a failing test that proves this bug exists.

prompt_templates.title: Refactor with tests
prompt_templates.prompt: My tests are green but I see duplication. Help me refactor while keeping all tests passing.

prompt_templates.title: Review TDD compliance
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this code and tests. Did I follow TDD correctly? Did I watch each test fail before implementing?

output_examples.input: Help me implement a retry mechanism using TDD
output: First, write a failing test that shows the retry behavior you want
Run the test to confirm it fails for the right reason
Implement minimal code to make the test pass
Run the test again to verify it passes
Refactor the code while keeping tests green
Repeat for each edge case (max retries, backoff, etc.)

output_examples.input: I found a bug where empty passwords are accepted
output: Write a failing test that proves the bug: test password validation rejects empty strings
Run the test to see it fail with the expected error
Implement minimal fix to validate password
Run tests to confirm fix works and existing tests still pass
Refactor if needed while maintaining test coverage

output_examples.input: My tests pass but I think I wrote them after the code
output: Check if you watched each test fail before implementing
If not, delete the implementation and start over with TDD
Write one minimal failing test first
Implement just enough code to pass

best_practices: Always watch the test fail before writing implementation code
Write the simplest code possible to make tests pass
Delete any code written without a failing test first
anti_patterns: Writing tests after implementation is complete
Keeping code as reference while writing tests
Testing mock behavior instead of real functionality

faq.question: Is TDD compatible with all programming languages?
faq.answer: Yes. TDD principles work with any language that has a testing framework. The cycle is universal.

faq.question: How do I handle legacy code without tests?
faq.answer: Add tests before changing legacy code. Write characterization tests that capture current behavior first.

faq.question: Can I use TDD with existing frameworks?
faq.answer: Absolutely. TDD works with React, Node.js, Python, Java, and any framework with a testing API.

faq.question: What if my tests are too slow?
faq.answer: Fast tests indicate good design. If tests are slow, your code may have coupling issues. TDD helps identify these.

faq.question: How minimal should green phase code be?
faq.answer: Extremely minimal. Hardcode values, write if statements, do whatever makes the test pass. Refactor comes after.

faq.question: Is TDD worth the initial time investment?
faq.answer: Yes. TDD saves time by catching bugs early, preventing regressions, and enabling confident refactoring.
